Boeing 707: Main landing gear: The Boeing 707 has more traditional landing gear with four wheels, while the Boeing 727 has landing gear that retracts into the fuselage.
Wings: The Boeing 707's wings are higher and more swept than the 727's.
Wing design: The Boeing 707 often has a kinked trailing edge on the wing, while the DC-8’s trailing edge is straighter.
Boeing 717: Modern livery: Boeing 717 typically has more modern airline liveries compared to the older liveries commonly found on DC-9 aircraft.

Fewer passenger windows along the length of the aircraft
